title: PEDOCS Score for Pediatric Emergency Department Overcrowding
desc: The Pediatric Emergency Department Overcrowding Scale (PEDOCS) estimates severity of overcrowding in pediatric emergency departments.

orgreference.text: Weiss SJ, Ernst AA, Sills MR, Quinn BJ, Johnson A, Nick TG. Development of a novel measure of overcrowding in a pediatric emergency department. Pediatr Emerg Care. 2007 Sep;23(9):641-5.

data.evidence: Pediatric ED Overcrowding Scale (PEDOCS)= 33.3 * [0.11 + 0.07 * (patients in the waiting room)+ 0.04 * (total registered patients)]
data.facts:
Score interpretation:

Level Score Interpretation
Level 1 1-20 Not busy
Level 2 21-60 Busy
Level 3 61-100 Extremely busy but not overcrowded
Level 4 101-140 Overcrowded
Level 5 141-180 Severely overcrowded
Level 6 181-200 Dangerously overcrowded
